website_summaries.verdict: The extendable bar is a unique but flawed idea, prone to slight warping that can jam the telescoping portion of the bar.
pros: The ability to collapse the bar for toolbox storage is a nice plus
Swivel head increases reach and application
Bar does a good job loosening lug nuts
cons: Bar can rotate and unlock during some tasks
Water can get inside the bar, causing corrosion
Bar may warp and no longer telescope after several uses

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, but don't let water inside the bar
customer_reviews.text: Very effective tool, but has two caveats. One, the handle is not completely fixed. I tried to twist it for some reason for leverage with a screwdriver inside of the handle hole, and the handle rotated. Two, and more of a concern, this is not water resistant. If water gets inside of it, the extension can jam. I had to knock it with a hammer and wedge to release the mechanism after it was lightly rained on. The water did come out, and it now works again, but I would not want to do that again. The extending handle is very effective to adjust depending on how much room needed or torque desired.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick the GREAT

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I took the time to research breaker bars. I thought I might be taking it too far, reading reviews and looking for differences. I mean seriously, how different can they be? But this really is a superior product. I wanted a rotating head vs fixed (mainly because this also works with my jack where a fixed angle won't). I liked the idea of having an extension handle if I need it. Most of the time you don't need it, but some times you do. The rubber handle on the end is nice to have. No complaints or any areas for improvement. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: B.H.

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely for changing tires
customer_reviews.text: Works nicely for changing tires. It feels a little flimsy when tightening lug nuts so if you plan on doing any jobs that require more torque than that I recommend getting something solid. Otherwise, good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Weekes

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great breaker bar, it can be used in so many more cases since it's adjustable. I use it for working on the cars where there are often cramped areas. It seems to be good quality too! You'll be happy with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: For the uninitiated, this is not a ratchet. With that said, I love this tool. It is adjustable for easy storage or fitting in tighter spaces. I bought it to replace the various parts of my water heater and now have used it to loosen other bolts I have difficulty it. I bought 1/2" to 3/8" so I can use my 3/8" sockets. Be careful not to apply so much torque that you strip your bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get the set.
customer_reviews.text: Collapsible so it fits in my tool bag, expandable so I get the leverage needed to loosen the toughest lug nuts. This tool along with a lug nut socket set (I purchased through Amazon.com ) makes for a powerful combo.
customer_reviews.author: Frank B

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 inch Break Bar
customer_reviews.text: Good heavy duty quality. Needed a good breaker bar for RV wheels in case of flat.
customer_reviews.author: Roy F

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a tuff little tool. It is just the right size for reaching over-torqued lawnmower nuts. Feels correct at each stop as I extend the handle.
customer_reviews.author: RallyPac

customer_reviews.title: It Does What it Should
customer_reviews.text: This breaker bar was able to break loose nuts tightened to over 400 ft-lbs with no problem. I had no problems with the extension.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce S.

customer_reviews.title: AmPro T20729 1/2" Drive Adjustable Breaker Bar is a must have!
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how well this breaker bar was made. The quality is very good; it should last a long time. I had some front suspension bolts that were rusted solid. This breaker bar freed them....took some muscle...but t worked!
customer_reviews.author: Steve J. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Real nice for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It's very sturdy and heavy. I really like how it extends. I would recommend it too, it's just what I was looking for at a nice price. Seems better than my broken Matco and snap on that just broke
customer_reviews.author: HMBTurboT

customer_reviews.title: Solid build
customer_reviews.text: This was great for my brake pad change when I had a few bolts that I couldn't remove with a small torque wrench. I don't have a lot of space for tools, so being able to adjust it like a telescope allowed me to keep it tucked away. Overall, I didn't get to use this on a daily basis as some might do. However for those stubborn bolts here and there, I'm certain that this will get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny T

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. I really love to used it.
customer_reviews.author: Erwin Kaw

customer_reviews.title: Nut buster
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on my frozen nuts, Able to break them especially with the extension. I store it in the car with socket on it for next time I can't break a nut.
customer_reviews.author: Homer godecker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about breaking it once it was fully extended but it seems stable.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: great breaker bar
customer_reviews.text: so far i really like it, love the fact that it can be extended
customer_reviews.author: Helen G Muir

customer_reviews.title: Great bar for even twice the price
customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily for loosening the lug nuts on my car. At 158 ft-lbs, I needed something sturdy and long. This bar does the trick just fine. It feels solid, and has a great positive engagement on the extension portion, which works nicely to fit it inside my tool box when not in use. For only $27 this is a HUGE value!!!
customer_reviews.author: T-Bone

customer_reviews.title: AmPro Chinese Support?
customer_reviews.text: Please do not buy products from AmPro. I actually liked the breaker bar that I purchased from them until it broke. It separated in two. The adjustable part of this breaker bar disassembled while adjusting it to its longest setting. A large and small ball bearing and one spring popped out. I contacted AmPro's customer service (IN CHINA) by email and they ignored my email. I was not asking for a refund, replacement or any monetary compensation. I simply desired instructions on how to repair the unit, to no avail. They did provide a Chinese support number, but no American support exists. The short of this is that once AmPro gets your cash, you are insignificant to them.
customer_reviews.author: Daz

customer_reviews.title: GREAT IDEA
customer_reviews.text: Very well made bar it works just fine. I put it to work the other day and it did just fine and the price was right GOOD DEAL!!
customer_reviews.author: Jack W. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Best breaker bar for its price and versatility!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the AmPro breaker bar for a month and a half now and am not disappointed. Mainly used to break loose lug nuts on vehicles with wheel-lock keys. Also used on european cars when an impact gun isn't strong enough. Coming out of the box, this tool is sturdy, heavy and well crafted. The interlocking adjustments come in handy for portability and also depending on the amount of torque needed for various tasks. Once locked in place, you don't have to worry about it coming out of adjustment while being used. Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: David Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good, while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I thought this breaker bar was great when I first got it. Fit in the tool box, easy to adjust, good leverage. After about a dozen car repairs over 18 months, the expansion joint got stuck and I no longer can change the length. I was trying to loosen the brake caliper mount bolts. I was pulling pretty hard. After I broke the bolt loose, the joint was stuck. It's good, just not for hard jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Quality, bad design.
customer_reviews.text: The item broke and was stuck in one position. So for the purpose of me buying. It wasn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Very good; recommended
customer_reviews.text: Well made; seems capable of being used to truly break undone stubborn bolts, nuts, etc. Compact size means it fits in my tool chest.
customer_reviews.author: gracethedog

customer_reviews.title: This tool can come apart very easily..
customer_reviews.text: This tool can come apart very easily... so make sure do not over extend it. Other than that... it's very useful.
customer_reviews.author: S Stein

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Innovative and does what I need It to do!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to carry a breaker bar in my H1 Hummer to facilitate the repair and installation of the serpentine drive belt. A fixed length bar would be too big to carry my tool box, so the telescoping feature of this bar made it ideal for my application. The quality of fit and finish is fine. It may not be a strong as a fixed forged bar for constant day in and day out use, but for the occasional emergency fixes I anticipate this breaker bar was just what the doctor ordered.
customer_reviews.author: DesertDJ

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, great for tightening lug nuts or axle nuts before measuring with a torque wrench. Fits great in my Tool box when collapsed and extends seamlessly for a good days work. No problems whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Turnip Boiler

customer_reviews.title: Enough leverage
customer_reviews.text: This fits the deep socket that will remove the anode rod in my water heater to replace the it for a new one. Watching a You Tube demonstration of this made me aware I would need leverage and so this is the leverage for the job. Amazon saves my water heater yet again!
customer_reviews.author: C. Manchester

customer_reviews.title: This thing works.
customer_reviews.text: Used it on the lugs of my expedition, over 150# torque and no problem, good feel with the locking mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Extending Mechanism broke after first use.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what people are using this this for with all the good reviews, but the extending mechanism broke on the first use. I would not recommend this for what it is intended for. I'll be returning this and getting my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Swantzify

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable breaker bar is a good value.
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable breaker bar takes the place of different sizes of breaker bars, all wrapped up in one tool. My son and I were working on our project car and having trouble with some very stubborn rusty bolts. We tried every tool we had and every spray penetrating oil we had access to, all failed. First time we used this bar, we got every one of those bolts loose. Great tool for a good value.
customer_reviews.author: F. Beman

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool to throw into your trunk in case you need to change a tire. I dont know how it will do in a heavy duty environment as the extension mechanism makes it a little bit flimsy, but if you are not using this on a shop Im sure you wont run into any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos D

customer_reviews.title: No Problem
customer_reviews.text: Not long after ordering this i got a flat on my truck. It made short work of getting the tire off. The build quality seems 9/10. The amount it extends seems a tad short but not worth worrying about.
customer_reviews.author: BGL

customer_reviews.title: It's really nice!
customer_reviews.text: It feels very solid, I love the grip, and the extender feels solid and well built. I also love that it easily fits in my toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: P. Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: It feels well made. Makes a good breaker bar for removing lug nuts. I wish they made 1/4" or 3/8" versions.
customer_reviews.author: Misowhorni

customer_reviews.title: Not flimsy. Good weight, solid. Nice length.
customer_reviews.text: Thought it would be iffy under a lot of torque, but it held up for the job I needed it for. Nice grip too.
customer_reviews.author: dktt

customer_reviews.title: Solid!
customer_reviews.text: Everything feels solid and well made. Although, Carelessness with the extension mechanism can make it jam up slightly (very minor issue). My gut feeling is it will provide years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Deform Lux

customer_reviews.title: Very useful.  Why did I wait.
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous. Very easy to use and with the variable length it fits into any location. One two three four five
customer_reviews.author: Robert Frank

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: yes it works well considering I use it about 80 times a day a work
customer_reviews.author: juli cover

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars62 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
